description: In nova/compute/api.py:SecurityGroupAPI.validate_property() is defined to validate security_group.name. But, this method is not being called while creating security groups.
title: Security group validations are not properly handled

comments.content: In nova/compute/api.py:SecurityGroupAPI.validate_property() is defined to validate security_group.name. But, this method is not being called while creating security groups.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~arathi-darshanam

comments.content:
By this we are able to create security groups with special characters
root@ubuntu1204:~# nova secgroup-create $@#%#$%#$ %$#%$^$%^$
+---------+-------------+
| Name    | Description |
+---------+-------------+
| #%#$%#$ | %0%$^$%^$   |
+---------+-------------+
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~arathi-darshanam

comments.content:
Existing Folsom code contains validations in the controllers class itself.
Example:
Keypairs Validation is defined in nova/compute/api.py: KeypairAPI,
SecurityGroups Validation is defined in nova/compute/api.py: SecurityGroupAPI,
Servers Validation is defined in nova/api/openstack/compute/api.py: Controller
This causes redundancy of validation methods

Instead we can have a module called validations, where all  the validations are defined.  This module can be imported in nova/compute/api.py and validate the input parameters.

<snip>
is_valid_as_servername = functools.partial(
Text.is_ascii_alpha_63, strategy="strict")
<snip>

Usage:
In nova/compute/api.py:
from nova.validation import is_valid_as_servername
...
if is_valid_as_servername(server["name"]):
    proceed
else:
    raise Error
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~arathi-darshanam

comments.content: As per Bug: 1032066, special characters should be allowed . Closing this as invalid.
